title: Iran in severe drought because of 'water bankruptcy, says former official | The World | ABC News
description: Residents in Iran's capital Tehran are praying for rain in the midst of a severe drought. With record low rainfall levels many of the country's major reservoirs are less than 5 per cent full. The country's President Masoud Pezeshkian is warning Tehran faces evacuation if the winter rains don't come. But it's not all about the climate. Kaveh Madani is the Director of the United Nations University's Institute for Water, Environment and Health, and was also the deputy head of Iran's environment department. He told The World's Girish Sawlani what's happening in Iran is akin to "water bankruptcy". title: House of Representatives to vote on releasing Epstein files | ABC NEWS
description: Members of the House of Representatives are set to vote on legislation requiring the Justice Department to release all unclassified documents and communications related to Jeffrey Epstein. If the bill passes, it will need to make it through the Senate and to President Donald for his signature. title: Dozens of ACT schools to reopen as asbestos risk remains low | ABC NEWS
description: Dozens of schools across Canberra are set to reopen as experts say asbestos contamination risk remains low. It comes after 70 schools across the ACT closed over fears of asbestos exposure from coloured sand products. title: Ex-Bangladeshi PM guilty of crimes against humanity, sentenced to death | ABC NEWS
description: Bangladesh’s ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death after being found guilty of ordering a brutal crackdown that killed hundreds of people. Hasina has been living in exile in India since fleeing Bangladesh in August 2024. It's not clear if India will extradite her. title: South Africa to investigate arrival of chartered plane carrying Palestinians | ABC NEWS
description: South Africa’s Foreign Minister has called for a full and thorough investigation after more than 150 Palestinians from Gaza arrived in Johannesburg on a chartered flight. South African President Cyril Ramaphosa says the passengers were allowed to disembark and won't send them back to the war-torn region. title: What polling reveals about voters and net zero | ABC News Daily podcast
description: The Liberals and Nationals have now officially dumped the net zero emission target from their climate and energy policy.    It keeps the Coalition together, but what do voters think?    Today, pollster, former Labor strategist and director of the RedBridge Group, Kos Samaras on whether it’s a winning strategy.   Featured:    Kos Samaras, director of the RedBridge Group

title: UN Security Council backs US plan for Gaza | ABC NEWS
description: The UN Security Council has approved a US-backed plan for Gaza that authorises an international stabilization force to provide security in the devastated territory and envisions a possible future path to an independent Palestinian state. Russia, which had circulated a rival resolution, abstained along with China on the 13-0 vote. The vote was a crucial next step for the fragile ceasefire and efforts to outline Gaza’s future following two years of war between Israel and Hamas. Arab and other Muslim countries that expressed interest in providing troops for an international force had signaled that Security Council authorization was essential for their participation. title: Victorian Liberal MPs choose Jess Wilson as new opposition leader | ABC NEWS
description: Victorian Liberal MPs have voted to replace Brad Battin with Jess Wilson to lead the party at the next state election. Current leader Brad Battin faced a challenge from first-term MP Jess Wilson, who is now the first woman to lead the Coalition in the state's history. The new Victorian Liberal leader said her main priorities were to bring the budget under control, end the crime crisis, increase access to healthcare, and make home ownership more accessible for all Victorians.  Video by the ABC News Social Media Team. title: Tasmania rock lobster fisheries closure due to China import rules | ABC NEWS
description: Two zones within Tasmania's rock lobster fishery were closed just hours after the commercial season opened.  The two zones are within 3 kilometres of salmon farms that are using the antibiotic florfenicol, and the closure is in response to concerns about the rock lobster industry's reputation in export markets. title: Tasmanian Liberal minister reneged on footy funding after club attended Labor presser | ABC NEWS
description: The North Launceston Football Club was sent a letter by the Tasmanian Liberals during the election campaign offering them $100,000 for a new club facility.  At a parliamentary scrutiny hearing on Monday, Sports Minister Nick Duigan revealed it was only a draft letter, and he chose not to ratify it after the club president appeared at a media conference with Labor. title: TPG says customer died after Samsung phone couldn't reach Triple Zero | ABC NEWS
description: TPG Telecom has confirmed a customer in Sydney died last week after a mobile phone could not make Triple Zero calls. The telco says early investigations indicated the failed calls were due to a Samsung device operating on software that was not compatible with making Triple Zero calls on the network. title: Parents urged to avoid cheap toys from online retailers following CHOICE investigation | ABC NEWS
description: CHOICE Director of campaigns Rosie Thomas has urged shoppers to avoid certain online retailers after a new survey found products from certain online retailers failed to meet safety standards. It tested 24 products and found the majority failed button battery safety standards. The small batteries can cause horrific and life-threatening injuries if swallowed.
